fields.content: If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking.
fields.author: Haruki Murakami

fields.content: Books are a uniquely portable magic.
fields.author: Stephen King

fields.content: Reading is important. If you know how to read then the whole world opens up to you.
fields.author: Barack Obama

fields.content: In books lies the soul of the whole past time.
fields.author: Thomas Carlyle

fields.content: The instruction we find in books is like fire. We fetch it from our neighbours, kindle it at home, communicate it to others, and it becomes the property of all.
fields.author: Voltaire

fields.content: You don’t have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them.
fields.author: Mahatma Gandhi

fields.content: A room without books is like a body without a soul.
fields.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

fields.content: I think of life as a good book. The further you get into it, the more it begins to make sense.
fields.author: Harold Kushner

fields.content: Books are mirrors: you only see in them what you already have inside you.
fields.author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

fields.content: There is a great deal of difference between an eager man who wants to read a book and the tired man who wants a book to read.
fields.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
